metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12412 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw in the libapreq2 v2.07 to v2.13 multipart parser can deference anull pointer leading to a process crash. A remote attacker could send arequest causing a process crash which could lead to a denial of serviceattack.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12412` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-apreq2 - 2.13-7
libapache2-request-perl - 2.13-7
libapreq2-3 - 2.13-7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libapreq2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.13-7').
